intro: Tolpis lagopoda, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright, branching stems covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a bluish-gray hue due to a dense layer of trichomes. Tolpis lagopoda is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
